text: Nyssa yunnanensis is a species of tree in the Nyssa genus. It is a dioecious tree (meaning that it has distinct male and female individual organisms) reaching in height. This flowering canopy tree inhabits mountainous tropical bogs and marshes.Sun, Bao-Ling et al. "Cryptic Dioecy in Nyssa Yunnanensis (Nyssaceae), A Critically Endangered Species from Tropical Eastern Asia", Annals of the Missouri Botanical Garden, Vol. 96, pp. 672-684 (December 2009). Because of habitat loss and logging, this species is critically endangered. It now exists only in the vicinity of Xishuangbanna, which is located in Jinghong County, Yunnan Province, China. ==References== ==Further reading== * Category:Nyssa (genus) Category:Trees of China Category:Endemic flora of Yunnan Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Plants described in 1977
title: Nyssa yunnanensis
